boat.name: Hetaire
boat.full_description: The Rouiller Brother's "Norwegian" boats (2 were built for use on Lake Geneva) are a light displacement version of the classic Norwegian double-ended cutter, with at "fin keel" below a shallow V hull. After WWII, due to lack of copper rivets, planking had to stop for 1 year, and due to lack of lead, an iron scrap in concrete keel was used. I am now in the process of rebuilding the keel fin  + lead bottom, and plan to launch Hetaire summer of 2021\. (The "Hetaires" were the consorts of Greek philosophers!)

I am now in the process of rebuilding the keel fin  + lead bottom, and plan to launch Hetaire summer of 2021\. (The "Hetaires" were the consorts of Greek philosophers!)
